results.title: Max's Farm
results.brief_description: Max is a perfectionist. He loves his farm and wants it to be the best. The ‘Farmer’s Weekly’ arrives and his farm rates 27th. That’s a great score, but Max wants it number 1. He tries to improve his farm by eliminating what he thinks are pests, but that just makes his farm worse. He has to find out how to get things work together.

results.title: Max's Christmas and 3 other Christmas stories
results.brief_description: Max’s Christmas It’s Christmas Eve and Max is too excited to go to sleep, so he sneaks downstairs to await Santa’s arrival … “Morris’s disappearing bag” Morris, the youngest child, is ignored on Christams morning until he discovers an overlooked present - a disappearing bag! These two stories are adapted from books by Rosemary Wells. “The Clown of God” Tomie de Paola’s classic picture book of the juggler who is too poor to give a gift to the Christ child. “The Little drummer boy” Joyful drumming, glowing illustrations and the voices of the St. Paul Choir School bring this well-known Christmas story to life. Illustrations by Ezra Jack Keats. Each of these stories is also available as an individual title.

results.title: Max's Christmas (K)
results.creator_credit: Michael Sporn, Paul R. Gagne, Weston Woods Studios and Michael Sporn Animation
results.brief_description: Ruby can’t get her little brother Max to go to sleep on Christmas Eve, and the fun begins as Max sneaks downstairs hoping to see Santa. Based on the book of the same title by Rosemary Wells. Voices: Jenny Agutter and Rex Robbins.

results.title: Mawson Base: face to face
results.creator_credit: Ian Toohill, Rob McCubbin, Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Education Dept. Materials Production
results.brief_description: Shot mainly around the Mawson area and narrated by Dr Phillip Law, this film looks at Antartica through the eyes of the expedition’s cook and the doctor. Raises issues on the future of Antartica and gives insight into the daily pressures of life in isolation. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mawson - Life and Death in Antarctica
results.brief_description: In a bold historical experiment, scientist and adventurer Tim Jarvis retraces Douglas Mawson’s Antarctic expedition of 1912 with the same meagre rations, primitive clothing and equipment to uncover what happened to Mawson physically-and mentally-as a man hanging on the precipice of life and death.
results.description: The Douglas Mawson Antarctic Expedition of 1912 is considered one of the most amazing feats of endurance of all time. Although his two companions perished, Douglas Mawson survived, but how? In a bold historical experiment, scientist and adventurer Tim Jarvis is retracing the gruelling experience, with the same meagre rations, primitive clothing and equipment to uncover what happened to Mawson physically-and mentally-as a man hanging on the precipice of life and death.
description_for_label: The Douglas Mawson Antarctic Expedition of 1912 is considered one of the most amazing feats of endurance of all time. Although his two companions perished, Douglas Mawson survived, but how? In a bold historical experiment, scientist and adventurer Tim Jarvis is retracing the gruelling experience, with the same meagre rations, primitive clothing and equipment to uncover what happened to Mawson physically-and mentally-as a man hanging on the precipice of life and death.

results.title: Mavis goes to Timor
results.creator_credit: Catherine Marciniak, Steve Westh, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
86 year old Mavis Taylor travels from Yarrawonga to East Timor on her first trip overseas. Against the odds, she plans to establish a sewing co-operative for the local women. Frustrated by bureaucracy, Mavis seeks assistance from the local community to help her transform an abandoned hospital into a warehouse and training centre for the co-operative. Her determination and perseverance is rewarded when the first order arrives and a group of local women are trained and organised to meet the delivery deadline. The project provides an opportunity for the women to establish economic security and independence for themselves and their community. During her stay in East Timor, Mavis also visits a church whose congregation was massacred by the Indonesian militia. Cinematography by Catherine Marciniak. Edited by Andrea Lang. Narrated by Anne Phelan.

results.title: Mauve Desert
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: As you drive Mauve Desert I hope you keep in mind where you sit and what drives you to understanding.’ This a story about Melanie, a fifteen year-old, who steals her mother’s car and drives into the desert. How she feels about herself and the process of becoming is echoed by her spoken thoughts on the desert landscape she drives through. Low-resolution graphics and a distinctive design style support the raw, and grungy atmosphere of Melanie’s world. The main interface is a map. The map promises adventure and danger, hinted at by the areas of the map lighting up. The offscreen sounds include dogs barking, gunshots and a car engine turning over. The narrative structure of Mauve Desert makes the user get stuck at certain points. We can only sit back and watch. Sometimes an area is available to click on, sometimes that area will not respond, encouraging the user to be opportunistic in future encounters. Different pieces of video will be produced at particular intervals, suggesting that an underlying logic holds the project together. The theme of understanding and interpretation is also reflected in the layers within the project where fact is merged with fiction. There is Maude Laures, the academic, who stumbles upon Melanie’s life in a second-hand bookshop. The project is based on the novel Le Desert Mauve by Quebeýoise author Nicole Brossard,Mauve Desert’.

results.title: Mauvais Sang = Bad Blood
results.creator_credit: Leos Carax, Philippe Diaz and Alain Dahan
results.brief_description:
Alex’s father, an old ganster, has just died. For old time’s sake, Alex asks two former accomplices of his father to organise one last robbery. The target is a new antidote designed to fight a virus called STBO. STBO is spread by having impersonal sex and is killing adolescents by the score. With ‘Mauvais Sang’ (his second film), Leos Carax finds his way into an esthetic movement of French cinema emerging in the 1980’s as ‘neo-baroque’ (aka ‘cinema du look’). Just like Luc Besson and Jean-Jacques Beineix, Carax favours outrageous lighting effects, a very pronounced acting style and a fetishist usage of objects. Awards: Prix Louis Delluc, 1986.

Credits: Producers, Alain Dahan, Philippe Diaz ; director, Leos Carax ; writer, Leos Carax ; photography, Jean-Yves Escoffier ; music, Charlie Chaplin, Sergei Prokofiev, Benjamin Britten.
Cast: Denis Lavant, Juliette Binoche, Michel Piccoli, Hans Meyer, Julie Delpy, Hugo Pratt, Serge Reggiani, Mireille Perrier, Jerome Zucca.

results.title: Maurice Sendak
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A visit to Maurice Sendak in his studio apartment, where he speaks of his favourite composers, expresses his admiration for painters and illustrators of the past, tells how these artists have influenced his own work, and traces the development of the book ‘Where the Wild Things Are’.
